results.title: Paddington goes to the movies
results.creator_credit: Paddington, FilmFair Communications, Graham Clutterbuck and Barry Leith
results.brief_description: Paddington is caught in a storm and shelters in the entrance of a cinema where he discovers that “Singing in the Rain” starring Gene Kelly is screening. Being an unaccompanied bear under 16, Paddington is not allowed in. However, he manages to peer through a keyhole and catches his first glimpse of the world of the silver screen. Unfortunately, in typical Paddington fashion, he also wreaks havoc in the theatre and the projection box. On his way home, in the excitement of the moment, Paddington tries to emulate the dancing of Gene Kelly. Narrated by Michael Hordern and based on the book by Michael Bond. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paddington, FilmFair Communications, Graham Clutterbuck and Barry Leith

results.title: Paddington for Prime Minister; Fishing for Paddington; Expedition Paddington
results.brief_description: Three animated stories about Paddington Bear. Paddington decides that he will toss his floppy hat into the political arena in “Paddington for Prime Minister”. Next, it’s off to the seaside in “Fishing for Paddington”. Then, only Paddington could turn a simple Brown family outing into a raging three ring circus in “Expedition Paddington”. Based on the beloved books by Michael Bond and features the voice of Tim Curry. All episodes are written by Bruce Morris with the exception of “Fishing for Paddington” which was written by Gordon Kent.

results.title: Paddington cleans up (K)
results.brief_description: Adapted from Chapter 2 from the book “Paddington on Top” by Michael Bond. Charming animated tale about neighbourhood free-loader, Mr Curry, plotting to have Paddington clean his house for free. However his plans come unstuck when Paddington is unable to locate a power point for his vacuum cleaner.

results.title: Paddington Bear Video Show 3
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
A compilation of ten Paddington Bear stories from the television series. Adapted from the Paddington stories written by Michael Bond.

results.title: Paddington and the cold snap
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Adapted from Chapter 1 from the book “Paddington Marches On” by Michael Bond. Paddington attempts to fix Mr Curry’s frozen water pipes but damages the bathroom so severely that the insurance company pays to have the entire room redecorated. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Paddington and the Christmas shopping; Christmas
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington and the Christmas Shopping is adapted from Chapter 6 of the book “More about Paddington” by Michael Bond. Paddington is on his way into the distinguished shop of Crunbold and Ferns but experiences trouble with the revolving doors. “Christmas” is adapted from Chapter 7 and for his first Christmas with the Brown family he receives a chemistry set, a scrapbook and a xylophone.

results.title: Paddington and the 'old master' (K)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington and the Old Master is adapted from Chapters 4,5, and 8 of “A Bear Called Padddington” by Michael Bond. Paddington learns from Mr Gruber, an antique dealer, that old master-pieces are sometimes covered by newer paintings and that the “old master” can be restored. Paddington decides to apply this technique to one of Mr Brown’s paintings with disastrous results. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
results.description:
